intro: Struthanthus rotundifolius, commonly known as the roundleaf struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are rounded and thick, adapted to the arid environments it inhabits. Struthanthus rotundifolius is often found in rocky soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
